meanings.definition: A type of microscopic organism found in infusions of organic matter.
meanings.sent1: Infusorians can be seen under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study infusorians to learn about tiny organisms.
meanings.sent3: The infusorians in the pond had a party under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: Like tiny dancers, infusorians move gracefully in their microscopic world.
meanings.sent5: The infusorians multiplied rapidly in the nutrient-rich solution.

meanings.definition: Organisms belonging to the class Infusoria, characterized by cilia or flagella for movement.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, infusorians with cilia swim gracefully.
meanings.sent2: Infusorians use their flagella to move through water.
meanings.sent3: The infusorians had a race using their cilia as oars.
meanings.sent4: In the world of tiny creatures, infusorians are the elegant swimmers.
meanings.sent5: The infusorians danced in unison, their flagella creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: A group of protozoans that are commonly found in freshwater environments.
meanings.sent1: Freshwater ponds are teeming with infusorians.
meanings.sent2: Infusorians play a vital role in the ecosystem of lakes.
meanings.sent3: The infusorians in the river had a picnic by the shore.
meanings.sent4: In the clear waters, infusorians shimmer like tiny jewels.
meanings.sent5: Children love observing infusorians swimming in the creek.
